trustfund:
TF051878-PHRD-MAURITANIA: SECOND MINING
            AND HYDROCARBONS SECTOR PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Mining Sector
            Capacity Building Project for Mauritania were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            moderate, Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            development impact through sector reforms with solid
            institutional strengthening is achieved with a sustained
            engagement - not through a one-shot 4 to 5 year project, but
            over 10 to 15 years. The inclusion of the oil component with
            the first additional financing and the buy-in of post-2005
            governments into extractive industries transparency
            initiative (EITI) are strong illustrations of policy
            dialogue which has required time before coming to fruition.
            Leverage for change is not directly linked to the volume of
            financing brought by the donors. Through its sustained
            efforts in policy dialogue and capacity building, with less
            than United States (U.S.) 45 million dollars over 15 years,
            the Bank has contributed to major institutional and
            structural changes in Mauritanian EI which cannot have been
            achieved through an engagement via to the single state-owned
            entity, societe nationale industrielle et miniere (SNIM).
            Promotion of local economic development was innovative at
            the time of project design. Such activities have later been
            widely adopted by subsequent Bank projects and within the
            industry at large. With established and well-documented
            procedures for consultation, decision-making, and
            accountability, such initiatives have gained much more
            legitimacy at local and national level.
